title: When to Transform a Model
question_text: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding transforming a model involving an explanatory and response relationship? I. One should consider transforming the data if the residual plot of residuals on $X$ fails to show a pattern. II. One should consider transforming the data if the scatterplot of $X$ against $Y$ shows a curved pattern. III. One should consider transforming the data if the correlation coefficient, $r$ , is $-0.30$ .
